medical_history.chief_complaint: Periumbilical and right sided abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient began experiencing diffuse achy, continuous abdominal pain at 10pm, with significant relief achieved by the following afternoon after taking acetaminophen. Symptoms later included anorexia, nausea, and chills, but no fever or vomiting. Mild right sided pain continued in the ED.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma, T2D, HTN, history of choledocholithiasis, bilateral total knee replacement, laparoscopic cholecystectomy.
